content:
It is relatively rare for a team to score two touchdowns on kickoff returns in the same game, as most kickoffs result in the receiving team taking possession of the ball and starting a drive from their own 20-yard line. However, it has happened a few times in NFL history. According to my research, there have been at least four instances of a team scoring two touchdowns on kickoff returns in the same game:

* On November 6, 1949, the Chicago Bears returned two kickoffs for touchdowns against the Green Bay Packers.
* On September 21, 1952, the Los Angeles Rams returned two kickoffs for touchdowns against the Chicago Cardinals.
* On November 14, 1971, the Kansas City Chiefs returned two kickoffs for touchdowns against the Denver Broncos.
* On October 22, 1972, the New England Patriots returned two kickoffs for touchdowns against the Buffalo Bills.

It's worth noting that these instances are relatively rare, and it is much more common for a team to score a touchdown on a kickoff return once or twice in a season rather than in the same game.
